title: Quick Gameplay Thoughts: January 30
body:
Hi folks,
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
**Usual Disclaimers**

These posts will often contain talk about future work we're doing, or planning to do, that isn't yet guaranteed to ship. The nature of the work could change or, depending on what we discover, projects mentioned may get delayed or even stopped. If you'd like to see a Tweet whenever a new one of these posts goes up: https://twitter.com/RiotMeddler
----------------------------------------------------------------------------  
**Refinements to Bounties**

We've got some adjustments to how bounties from CSing are calculated coming in 9.3. Our goal with introducing CS based bounties was to recognize when players and their teams were substantially ahead via CS gold and give catch up opportunities in those cases, rather than only when a player was ahead on kills. In some cases that's been working well, in others however players have been ending up with CS bounties not because they're ahead, but because they've caught up since their last death. We'll be making some changes behind the scenes to the CS bounty calculation as a result so that the threshold to hit a bounty better reflects actual game state, meaning that you should only have a bounty from CSing when you're meaningfully ahead.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------   

**Healing on Akali Q**

At this point it's likely we'll be taking the healing off Akali Q. We're doing so because we believe the current set of tools Akali has means she's lacking in sufficient weaknesses, in lane in particular. Sustain is generally a tool we give to characters who have weaker all ins, or difficulty making an all in happen when they want. Akali's pretty good in both those regards however. Trying to trade and gradually grind down a champ with all in strength's normally a good response, sufficient healing nullifies that as a weakness however. Couple that with decent waveclear from Akali (in part because she uses energy, not mana), plus decent roaming to take advantage of that pushing, and it's hard to find strong enough weaknesses against her. That lack of clear enough weakness is then amplified again by Akali's ability to flex between multiple positions, allowing her to sometimes take a more advantageous match up. Being a flex pick isn't an inherently problematic thing, but it does add additional power to an already hard to punish kit. 

It's certainly possible that removing Akali's healing leaves her in a pretty rough spot overall though. In cases like this where a champion's been problematic for an extended period we've had decent success in the past by taking a heavy pass to them to remove issues, then going back and adding power shortly after if needed once we've seen where they've landed. Zoe early last year was a good example of that, proving very difficult to get into an ok spot power and frustration wise with a series of smaller adjustments. Only after we took a really heavy pass and then put some power back in were we able to get her to a better, more stable state. We're looking at potentially bringing Akali's based HP5 up to average, from quite low, in 9.3 alongside the nerf, larger compensation, if needed, would be later though. 
----------------------------------------------------------------------------    
**More Updated Movement Animations**

We’ve got another round of updated walk/run (mainly) animations hitting the PBE shortly. Feedback on these once they’re there much appreciated. As before we’re targeting movement animations generally because they’re seen so often, so they’re a great way to improve a champion’s overall visual quality for the time involved per animation.

* Dr Mundo - Mundo does things his way. In this case that means getting an updated Q throw animation instead of a walk or run anim.
* Gragas -  Updated base run 
* Katarina - Updated base run 
* Lux - New no boots walk anim and updated base run
* Shen - New no boots walk
* Twisted Fate - New no noots walk anim 
* Zyra - New no boots walk

replies.body: Hi Meddler, can I ask for some  more context regarding the magical boots nerf since they seem really left field. I understand you guys are reverting them but what justified it in the first place

Some concern from people it's an overly effective and safe pick. Probably backing away from the nerf though, don't think they're causing that much of a problem overall and high usage rate partly just reflects other choices in that tree being niche or less appealing.

Hi Meddler, two quick questions:

Is {{champion:53}}  still getting an ezreal style update?

Has Nexus blitz playrate met or exceeded any expectations?

Blitz is still a potential candidate for an Ezreal style update. Nothing committed to beyond that though at present.

Nexus Blitz play rate dropped off real hard once the missions for it ended. We're assessing what to do as a result, had been hoping its baseline appeal would stay higher. Overall it dropped down to a pretty similar play rate to its first run.

Just wanna say the reason I stopped was that the missions were pretty consuming meaning that once the missions were over I must have played like 50-75 Nexus blitz matches, imo that was a lot of Nexus blitz for month period

I kinda disliked the short term missions. Sometimes you'd be stuck with missions that were based on RNG (like the scuttle-race mission), and I had to grind out games, as opposed to playing Blitz for some certain goal.

I did like that there was a mixture of short and long term missions, so you didn't have to focus on the missions every time.
Nexus Blitz is fun and all and  I really liked it but after the missions I felt kind of meh with it. Game mode is still good.

Hi Meddler,
Have you thought about possibly moving Akali's heal to her passive auto? She would no longer be able to heal off the wave therefore reducing her sustain in lane phase and also make it a lot harder for her to heal in ranged matchups. Completely removing spell vamp/healing from Akali's kit seems like destroying an aspect of the champions identity that she has always had and removes one of the things that had always made her unique. As well I would argue her all-in isn't nearly as strong as other mid-lane assassins due to the delays in her burst caused by her passive circle and the delays on her ultimate,I feel like if her heal is removed she will just become like every other assassin but with worse burst potential.

Ok wow this is probably the best solution I have read today. Really like the idea and it would also support an aggressive and more calculated playstyle instead of just spamming Q at minons when at 180 Energy. Hope that the Riot Team sees this.

So what's the most likeliest way that Akali will be compensated for losing her healing? Her base stats are pretty atrocious for a champion designed to work mid (due to her having in kit sustain), not to mention the energy costs of her Q will no longer make sense due to the loss of the healing,

I know it's an unsatisfying answer, so apologies in advance, but besides normalizing her HP5 we'll want to wait an see how she does with the nerfs before putting power back in somewhere. We feel our success rate's been quite a bit better with problem champions splitting nerfs and buffs than trying to predict too much ahead of time.

You probably won't see this, but have you guys considered either:

1. Substantially nerfing the healing on her Q by a percentage

2. Transfer the heal on her to empowered auto attack, so she can still trade effectively, but at the same time, not be able to freely sustain back up in lane without risking her safety?

I understand not wanting to overbuff a frustrating champion, but something seems strange. 
I recall someone (not you though?) saying the intention was to take power out of her shroud and then redistribute it elsewhere in her kit. 
She's already a fairly weak champion, so a small nerf coupled with added regen to a champion who cant utilize it (She isnt building {{item:3077}} {{item:3107}} {{item:3010}}), while a step in the right direction, needs more. 
Reduce the lockout on her R2 maybe, flatterns her learning curve a lot and lowers TTK (apparently, a high TTK compared to most assassins was the reasoning for Obscured?) across all elo/experience levels.

I understand why you're doing what you are regarding Akali, and I hope I don't come off as belligerent. But at the same time, leaving a champ to rot for a patch just feels horrible to those that enjoy playing them. In the same vein as the HP5 buff, wouldn't a small base armor buff be helpful?
Unfortunately you're not the first. I think you should feel reassured that they're considering buffing her while other champs have remained in the gutter for years now

There has been lots of talk around social medias about a potential nerf/removal of Conqueror and potential replacement with a fervor of battle styled keystone. Can you expand on this?

Hey Meddler, 

As an Akali player, I understand that the 'Nerf to zero to figure out what went wrong' approach will probably be the best option for her in the long run, but I feel like the lack communication about that intention was what hurt the most. Up to this point the focus on Akali's balance was the shroud. What to do about the shroud. Should the shroud make her untargetable by turrets. Is there enough counter play around the shroud. That along with the fact that all previous mentions on the work with Akali was that she would be "Adjusted" gave the impression that only the shroud would be touched and she would get compensation some other way. I was fine with the possibility of the shroud being nerfed to the ground but was interested in what might be the potential buffs. Then the heal and her sustain gets gutted and the shoe drops. 

While the Zoe approach to balancing is probably the best for champs like Akali who's abilities are so intertwined with each other that it is impossible to make a simple numeric adjustment to fix any integral issues, I would have been more comfortable if the plug was pulled early and communication was up front and honest about what your intentions were. I also feel like the community backlash from Akali players would have been lessened too if there wasn't moths of only discussing her shroud. 

I hope by the end of this Akali is still a skill expressive champ that can be played in Mid or Top with interesting mechanics to bring to the table. I can think of many interesting things that could be added to her passive mechanics, Q, or ultimate and I am sure you guys are already thinking about what possible paths you could take her. I just hope you can be more up front about your goals and setting our expectations. 

Hope you have a good day and i thanks for reading if this catches your eyes

Are there any plans on reducing the gold given by turret plating or making it immune/extemely resistant to Demolish/Rift Herald? Right now it's the safest way to get gold due to plating gold not increasing your bounty at all. Lane bullies and assassins shouldn't be rewarded with 3 kills worth of gold for winning lane on top of all previous advantages they'd get before turret plating.
What are your thoughts on Sylas so far. His performance seems pretty lackluster from what I can see. It looks like its more than just a learning curve.

After giving him some time we felt we'd started him off a bit weak, hence the hotfix about a day ago that gave him a bit of base AD, MR/level and E damage. Overall he's generally playing as we'd expected pattern wise, including both player successes and failures based off ults stolen, hence the focus on just some simple power for now to complement the learning curve.

Hello Meddler,

I hope you will read this, becaus I will try to write my thoughts detailed about the planned Aatrox changes.

The changes on the pbe right now, are going to a wrong direction.

Problems
1. Removing the charge system on E seems legit. But the second direction you mentioned, in your last QGT, is way better. Having only 1 E every 9-5 sec is bad. You are able to poke realy hard in the early game, but late it gets difficult to hit the comb right.
2. Removing E's spell vamp against minions completely, is wrong. It's one of the only thing remaining from the old Aatrox.

Solutions
1. Take the second direction you mentioned with the renekton like E. It will help the enemy to play around it, since it will be on cd, sometime after the first cast. But it won't hurt his all in potential.
2. Removing it, is the wrong choice. Perhaps you should just replace it. E.g. the second E cast (if renekton like E) gives you extra healing from all sources (including minions). This would still reduce his lane sustain and also lead to a more aggressive second e cast, instead of saving it as a disengage.
OR at least increase the healing on champimos a little bit.

Thoughts
Pls try the second direction with his E. Somthing like 16-8 sec cd with the current 3-1 sec cd in between each cast. Also the recast has to be within 4 seconds so you can do the Q comb right. Or something like that... :)

Do you think forcing this item into an Energize enhancer item is a good idea? Looking at the numbers and the power of the power of the effects, it looks like Stormrazor will be bad on its own and a horrible choice as a single item for many of the champions who could flex into it, but it will be very strong for the few ADC thay build multiple Energize items. I think it would be better if the Energize enhancement effect was spread out over all of the Energize items so they all scale based on the number Energize effects you have, instead of forcing Stormrazor to be a niche item.

You guys posted 5 months that support items would be looked at, support tier 3 item aren't build by support (Remnant of the aspect HP just too low for the cost and what it used to give, and the other two are just not worth it just for the extra ward), I understand that locket was frustating to play against in a Meta where Tank Junglers could give a 2K shield but the game changed to a more early game focused kind of gameplay, think the item could see some changes (CD or Shield value idk to be honest). You know i've been asking for a long time and sent a lot of messages but i think it would be nice to just have a conversation about the support role cause atm, it became a lot more offenssive then it should be, you're not rewarded as a support for being a support to your team but more like a second carry in the botlane especially with how weak Crit adcs are atm.
